info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 09 at 9:33PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT EDT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of the Piedmont of North Carolina, including the following county, Mecklenburg. * WHEN...Until midnight EDT tonight. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 931 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - High flows are expected along Little Sugar Creek, Irwin Creek, and Briar Creek around the city of Charlotte. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Uptown Charlotte, Central Charlotte, South Charlotte, Southwest Charlotte, Freedom Park, Southpark Mall and The Plaza. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
